website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive and long-lasting, these boots are a great value buy.
pros: These tough boots are well-built and have great arch support
They may look a bit plain, but they're more durable than most Caterpillar boots and much of the competition
cons: These run a bit narrow, and some customers reported a popping sound while they walked

customer_reviews.title: Quality is going down hill.
customer_reviews.text: These used to be the best boots. I work construction, im always on metal roofs, these stick nice to roofs.They now only last me 4 months of use. I used to wear them down to the sole for years, but the last 4 pairs The rubber separates from sole and they are junk.I get 4 to 6 months use out of them. Bought this pair in February it is now the end of June..sad..This will be my last pair.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra W

customer_reviews.title: 1st pair lasted me 4 years and 5 months after nearly daily wear and abuse - getting another pair now.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these May 2012 - it's now Oct 2016. 4 years 5 months and it's time for another pair and I am buying these exact same boot. They have been great and offer extremely good value for the amount of abuse and use I put them through. They worked perfectly for me and as such I am BUYING another pair. 1st pair lasted me 4 years and 5 months after nearly daily wear and abuse - IN Short I am getting another pair now.
customer_reviews.author: VaporTrail

customer_reviews.title: These aren't for ballroom dancing
customer_reviews.text: I expected at least a week of discomfort from a pair of new work boots. The first two days in these were a little rough but by day 3 they were surprisingly feeling pretty good. Now they're comfy as hell, tough as nails, and they look pretty awesome. Just 3 days into owning these boots I dropped a 300lb generator and thought it missed my foot completely. When I tried to move I found out that the generator was sitting nicely on top of my steel toe. Barely a scratch on the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Brenner, PMP

customer_reviews.title: Quality gone way down
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these boots. The other two pairs where comfortable, and lasted a good time. (2 years) This most recent pair has been Very disappointing. In the top of the inside, right behind the steel toe, the material pokes down and rubs on my foot when doing a lot of crouching and kneeling and causes alot of discomfort. And then it stays stuck down, and I have to take the boot off to push it back up. My dad had this same problem with his. Also after purchasing in February, and 2 of those months since then they weren't worn, they are already falling apart at the seams.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worn them for almost two years.  Laces finally gave.
customer_reviews.text: I like how Amazon tells you the last time you ordered a specific item. I purchased these back in June 2016. First time I tried Cat shoes and fell in love with them. I was a Timberland Pro Series guy before. I decided it's time to replace them now in April 2018. Shoes are still intact but I finally destroyed the laces. Tells you how well these hold up. Could just replace laces but decided to take advantage of my work's shoe policy. I switch becase the my old Timberland Pro didn't provide the traction (indoor manufacturing) and the arch location seemed odd. The switch fixed both issues.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie B

customer_reviews.title: Where's QC?
customer_reviews.text: The left boot was bigger than expected but with some thicker socks fit and felt ok. The right boot was different story. The joint where the steel toe meets the top of the boot was a thick and abrupt squeeze on the top of my foot, right above the arch. I thought it would work out after a bit of walking around the house, but the pain only got worse. QC, you got one job to do! Please ferret out the junk shoes from the line. Could try another pair, but not worth taking the chance.
customer_reviews.author: GeeDave

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Experience!
customer_reviews.text: We just bought these 2 weeks ago, my husband wore them for about 4 days when he developed a very painful lump on the ball of his toe. He stopped wearing them for about a week now and its almost completely better. Very disappointed, and wouldnt recommend to anyone!!! *Wanted to add that he's never had this problem with any other boot, that's all he wears is work boots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT waterproof in anyway
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who is a truck driver, we live in upstate new york so he needed something that would keep his feet at least semi-dry. These are not it, his feet are soaked if he even so much as looks at anything wet. His feet are soaked after just climbing in and out of the truck, walking for two minutes through snow, he doesn't make a habit of standing in puddles so apparantly, the boots just suck and its super disaapppointing
customer_reviews.author: William I.

customer_reviews.title: they fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: I do not think they are real caterpillars and if you read this then you will probably read the questions too,if you do please do not do what I did and buy them because some lady runs her mouth off about a warranty ,they do not have a warranty it is not a year ,not here and not at the website.I really am very angry that amazon does not make sellers verify those questions it is just wrong. I really would not of spent the extra money on these boots without the warranty either.
customer_reviews.author: julierobin seeger

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I managed to buy these a couple of years ago when they were on sale and I could not have picked a better pair of boots. They have held up well and I use them not just around the house but also for work. They show no signs of tearing, and besides some scuff marks on the front I expect them to last me a long time. They are also steel toed which will help protect your feet. I could not be any happier and will be looking for another pair from Caterpillar once its time to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: DM Reviews

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that would be safe cutting firewood and other stupid guy things that I sometimes do. These boot are insurance for my toes. I did buy a pair of expensive inserts which helped but whereas I have only worn them a few times they are still a little stiff and appear to be hard on my feet. Not a big deal because everyone is different so it is not a demerit. They are perfect enough for my use.
customer_reviews.author: A. LOPILATO

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet expectations. Tight and scratch easily.
customer_reviews.text: I have had them for about 2 months(9/14/2019. They seem to be a pretty good boot. But the upper part (where the laces start) seems to have been stitched a bit small or not enough material used. I had to loosen completely the laces and wear them loose and even then it presses badly on the top of my foot leaving a red sore indent mark after a whole day of work. First boot that has done this. The leather does scratch very easily also. I don't like giving bad reviews but these honestly didn't meet my expectations. Especially since I've had friends recommend CAT footwear. How durable they are..to be continued.......
customer_reviews.author: Luis B.

customer_reviews.title: Really? You need a review for a CAT product?
customer_reviews.text: Fits as described. Lasts longer than your pants will. Generations of pants, actually. I bought as a motorcycle boot at $100, less than 30 minutes they were sexting my feet. Yes, there are better, more fashionable, motorcycle shoes out there, at double the price and half the wear. I can take down a tree and get on my bike and head home without a worry. WARNING: Patriots Gillette Stadium, at -20 Fahrenheit, sets off the metal detectors. Water proof for 3 years, so far. Never cold feet (New England). Summer, a bit warm walking, but fine at speed. CAT makes a serious boot.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Such a Deal!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn boots for 40yr, so I know good boots when I slip them on. These will be my favorites for awhile. They are surprisingly light. The full leather uppers will not be deteriorating. The soles are thick and grip well. It provides so much cushioning that I had to take a boot off to figure out how they do that (padded insoles). To add to all of the above, these are really good-looking boots. One caveat: There are (8) big rivets inside each upper, so make sure you wear high, thick socks, and pull the tongues over the rivets, or you will have bloody ankles (see picture). As long as you do that, you will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the boots worked out great. After a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: At first, the boots worked out great. After a few weeks, some of my toes started to rub against the front of the shoe lining and it started to cause massive discomfort. I tried different socks but got the same discomfort. The leather is not the best quality because it feels very thin in spots. One of those thin spots were located on some stitching near the heel, and tore through after a month. For beater boots I'm sure these are fine, but if you need something that you can be in all day without discomfort, I'd look elsewhere. Keens or Redwings would be the obvious choice.
customer_reviews.author: pooter

customer_reviews.title: Tongue sewed crooked...
customer_reviews.text: Love the boots, but hate the tongue on the right boot. It wasn't sewed on straight like the left one. Therefore it constantly slides to one side exposing the sock in the middle. I've tried everything to no avail. Since I live paycheck to paycheck, I can't afford to pay for another pair, so I'll just live with it until it drives me nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wolfington

customer_reviews.title: decent boots
customer_reviews.text: first thing to get out of the way; I did return these boots, but this was purely out of that I needed boots I could wear immediately for long periods of time, for me, no amount of breaking in these boots would have allowed me to keep these pros; super easy to get on and off; this is a very important aspect to me when it comes to boots very good looking boots and are very durable cons; super wide; I have wide feet, but these boots are way wider basically no arch support; do get some good insoles if you get these boots
customer_reviews.author: Scott Walters

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing fit
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this boot was great until I went to put it on with a sock. Where the tongue (the bit behind the laces) attaches to the rest of the boot, there is an edge. The edge has an overhang that when slipping your foot in with a sock, rolls the overhang towards the front of the boot. It is virtually impossible to get your finger in there to pull the rolled material back, and it hurts because it creates a ridge. Poor design for an otherwise seemingly well-built boot. Needless to say, I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: AlanO

customer_reviews.title: They look different than depicted
customer_reviews.text: I love the CAT Excavator boots, but boy was I disappointed with these. Mostly a decision based on looks, but they also run very small. The toe is much more pointy and narrow than depicted in the images. Also, the leather was nowhere near as dark, and a really non-uniform color. They looked more like "fashion" boots than work boots, and needless to say, I sent them back. Not my cup of tea. First thing I've ever sent back to amazon, and the return was an overall painless experience, I printed a label and dropped off at an Amazon locker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give a lower rating.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these boots last week and when the package arrived the box was previously damaged and taped back together. I open the box and noticed the sole padding of the shoe is missing. I asked for a replacement and they arrived today. Both shoes have noticeably been work with damage and scratchs all over the boots, inside the box has many stains (no idea what from) also which is absolutely disgusting is someone's long black curly hair is inside my NEW shoes and the bottom of the box. Im absolutely disgusted and not happy with my purchase or my replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Justo

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't reccomend them.
customer_reviews.text: The quality seems fine but the size runs tight. I usually take a 9 wide so that's what I ordered. They don't fit like any other 9 wide I've ever worn. They are tight. There's also a seem at the back of the heel that's irritating. Really pulling tight on the speed loops helps a bit but after a while the heel seem will start rubbing again. As for arch support they dont seem to be that great. Not the worst but far from great. Same can be said for cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dowd

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I got these boots for my husband for Christmas. He is a mechanic and usually goes through a pair of boots once a year so this year we went with these. Being Caterpillars I thought they would last longer but after normal everyday wear they are falling apart and soaking his feet after not even 3 months. Very dissatisfied. I would like for the seller to get ahold of me and make this right
customer_reviews.author: ACO

customer_reviews.title: Have had great luck with many CAT boots in the past
customer_reviews.text: Have had great luck with many CAT boots in the past. Decided to try these based on personal past experience with the brand and other reviews. These were terribly uncomfortable, and you can't remove the insoles to replace with another one, it was glued in place, I had to rip it out and scrape off the chunks. Put in some upgraded insoles that I've used before, they helped a little, but still very uncomfortable. They do seem to be durable enough though if you can stand to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: mrbighughjass

customer_reviews.title: Pinches foot
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size larger, and the wide version. Yes, the boot is longer and wider than my foot. BUT, it is WAY too short! The boot pinches down on your foot about an inch behind your toes, even when you are standing straight on level ground. And no, i do not have an unusually tall feet or anything. Just normally shaped feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Good boots for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just received my second pair of these. I got a yr out of the last pair. You may be thinking that 1 yr is not very long for heavy duty boots. For you, probably. Mine are worn 70 hrs a week and put through hell. I WAS buying the $140Timberlands and Wolverines for years and they only lasted 1 yr also. I have a wide foot and sooner or later it tears the stitching away. These are half the price and almost as well built as Wolverines...almost. If you don’t have to buy a pair every year like me then splurge for the big name brands, they’ll be slightly more comfy but won’t last any longer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Barbier

customer_reviews.title: Old Photos = False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: The toe box of this boot is designed for a small child. Boot has NO wiggle room in the toes at all. Old, deceptive photos give the illusion that this boot has plenty of room for comfort, but I'd wager four-inch stiletto heels would be more comfortable. Clearly the manufactures have skimped and trimmed away material to save a buck, absolutely ruining this product. DO NOT BUY THIS BOOT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for work
customer_reviews.text: I use them everyday for work and they never leave my feet feeling tired. I stand all day long loading and unloading trucks. Steel toe protects against those painful mistakes when something lands on your foot. I bought a pair of Timperlands too, steel toe and these perform better and are more comfortable to me. Timeberlind has no insert inside it, nothing for comfort at all. I had to add a Dr Sholl's gel insert, just to live with them. I won't buy those again.
customer_reviews.author: ruben

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart in less than half year and smell
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots because I work as an auto mechanic at a dealership and haven’t even had them for half a year yet ! ! And already the inside of the boot at back of the heel is wearing out and has a hole in them is one thing. The other is the laces are already tearing apart and lastly they started smelling within 2 months and progressively have gotten worse
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Postawa

customer_reviews.title: Tough boot, but a bit too uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit torn on these boots. They are great looking tough boots, but mildly uncomfortable. There is not enough cushion around the calf and the soles are kinda flat and hard. The toe is narrow and kept rubbing against my big toe. I would recommend a wide even you you don't normally wear wide, or size up by 1/2. I was planning on powering through with them till they broke in, but the stitching on one boot started to unravel and that was the deciding factor for me to return them. I really wished these worked out, they are great looking tough boots.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product
customer_reviews.text: Just putting the CAT brand on something does not equate to quality. (Frankly, I'm shocked they would cheapen their brand in this manner.) The boots are made of extremely hard & thin leather. Not comfortable. Does not conform to your foot over time like quality leather. They are collecting dust on my shelf. I graduated from this extremely low quality boot to a pair of Timberlands (average quality) to a pair of Wolverines. I'll never buy anything but Wolverine going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Public user

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying boots for years that are semi-acceptable in white-collar settings and also are waterproof, tough, and have a steel toe for the work setting. I drift back and forth between these locations daily. These boots look better after 6 months than my last 8 hard leather pairs including Timbs, Carolinas, and Carhartt. All of these other brands for around the same price started to fall apart at the seams or the leather got so scuffed they went into the at-home project pile. The huge logo gets tucked under my Dickies. I will likely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F. Frantz

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! A+
customer_reviews.text: So far so good after my husband has worn these at work, in a very physical job that requires lots of walking on various terrains, including on pavement and constant turning back and forth on metal grates. I think he has really liked them! He said they weren't too comfy during the break-in period, but other than that, so far they have been great boots for the price! Note: I also ordered him powerstep insoles for arch and heel support to replace the very flat ones that come inside. We would recommend them... Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Tight and not in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Good looking boot, functions well enough. I’m probably not the best reviewer for a boot being 300lb electrician I tend to be hard on my feet to the point where my last boots almost disintegrated. So far these boots do the job in all departments minus the sizing... normally I wear an 11 and that has room to spare if I have to double up on Socks. But these boots are very tight and narrow more so than I expected.... like I said above being a big guy in construction boots break in rather quickly for me. These are still stiff. I would say 4/5 stars overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, comfortable, smells like piss...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I poured foot powder into the boots and let them sit for 2 weeks. The ammonia smell has rescinded, but is still there. With a lot of foot powder and diligence I can live with this. I'm changing my rating from 2 to 3 stars. Seem to be good quality, but a couple months later they stink. I know what your thinking: " This guy has some nasty feet! " That is not entirely correct. These boots smell like cat urine. I have never had this experience before. Anyway, if you are looking for durable work boots that make people think you can't control your bladder, search no more...
customer_reviews.author: mujjy wujjy

customer_reviews.title: great fit
customer_reviews.text: I've had the boots for about 3 weeks and they feel really comfortable. they are not work shoes for me, i.e. construction or shipyard. I wear them around the yard for grass cutting, routine outside task or working on the cars. the sole is firm and still has that 'new boot resistance' when taking a step. but the leather is soft, easy to get on and off; easy to sting up. i'd buy these again. i'm most impressed with how soft and comfortable they feel.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not wide!
customer_reviews.text: Both the box and the tongue of the boot says that these are wide. However my regular width boots I've had for a year are wider than these. I put these on for maybe 5 minutes and took them right off and started a return. I will not be buying any shoes from Cat or wolverine since they make these boots. First impressions are what make and break a person or company. And I did not get good impressions on the quality control side. They need to label there products right.
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a good solid shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had this same pair of boots years ago. They had been in great shape for 6 years until I lost them when I was traveling in Texas. I recently decided to order these again, and they're as good as ever and the quality is still great on these. This is a worthwhile investment because these boots are built well and last for a long time. Worthy every penny and highly recommended if you are doing a lot of physical work and need to protect your toes, or just need boots that last a really long time.
customer_reviews.author: James W

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for the price - outperforms much more expensive boots.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the bomb. My husband was shredding much more expensive boots in less than 6 months. The ramp on his truck was like a cheese grater on the soles. These boots have held up really well. He's had them over 6 months now and there's no sign that they will need replaced any time soon. He did mention that they were a bit hard to break in, as pretty much all boots are. There's not much arch support, so insoles are recommended. Still, awesome boot for the price. There's a reason that CAT has been making this exact boot for decades now.
customer_reviews.author: Kris KC

customer_reviews.title: Not CAT anymore, not quality either!!!
customer_reviews.text: Quality for Cat dropped a LOT!!! Fits a bit larger than others in same size and you will notice also the difference in quality. I had to ship it back(easy at Amazon) and went for Cactus and believe me, is WAY WAY better and fits as it should. Very stiff leather and not what CAT used to be. Have another CAT pair for over ten years now and when you polish those they look like new. These are not made to last....
customer_reviews.author: Mitch N.

customer_reviews.title: Good work boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots to support my feet after working in a bakery 12-16 hours a day 6 days a week in cheap boots i got from walmart, these boots have significantly reduced pain and fatigue in my feet and knees within the first week wearing them. Update - after a few months of use these boots are still holding up and my feet haven't hurt
customer_reviews.author: William F.

customer_reviews.title: Something's changed.
customer_reviews.text: These boots used to be great and would last me longer than a year. The pair I got in 12/2018 have already cracked several times on the sole. The leather is also cracked. The boots leak terribly too. The quality has gone way down for whatever reason and it's time to move on and try a different brand. A shame really as I've bought this exact boot the last several years. I do HVAC for a living and the boots are never exposed to mud. It's mostly just a lot a of daily walking and climbing ladders and stairs. They do get wet from the elements though (snow/rain).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Looking to replace work shoes I wore for past few years with a steel-toed version as I frequently "balance" work items (e.g., drywall and plywood panels) on the toe of my shoes when moving materials around the shop. Very comfortable and protective of my toes and arches. I'm an avid DIYer and will frequently spend 8+ hours standing at my workbench or on a ladder. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Dave

customer_reviews.title: Really nice work boots- Caterpillar steel toe 2nd Shift
customer_reviews.text: Just received. I liked the way the boot looked. Quite classy and we'll built. Son usually wears 9 1/2 med Saucony sneaker Grid. We bought 9 med and it fit. Company is fantastic. I bought a 9.5 wide and it was too big. They were extremely helpful and fast. I returned the next day and all is perfect. My son sometimes used wide and sometimes medium. Wonderful looking boots just like picture and everything was very fast. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: MT- San Fran

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money but I won't buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for over a year now. I've probably wore them at least 5/7 days a week minimum since then. Other than buying new insoles after my feet starting to really hurt and a set of new laces these boots have done well. The outside layer has started to rip a bit which means in a couple of months they will probably be way worse. I'd recommend them for someone who won't wear the crap out of them but for someone who will be wearing them as often as I do, I'd suggest getting a better more expensive pair of boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Michele Eckstine

customer_reviews.title: Fake product
customer_reviews.text: don't buy that shoes, the one they post in the photo is not what they will send to you. they sent me a trash that look nothing for $89, it is a crime
customer_reviews.author: E L.

customer_reviews.title: Kicking Myself !!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are pretty low quality. They're not complete junk, but they're pretty low end.... Compared to my 8 yr old Bramah's , they suck. The "leather" (if that's really what it is) is very thin. The soles aren't as thick or as tough as 8 yrs of work wear on the Bramah's. The soles are soft not hard like a good work boot should be. I don't expect them to last.
customer_reviews.author: Denver Loveless

customer_reviews.title: At the price range this are by far the best
customer_reviews.text: At first they felt slipery on flat surfaces with water, but now i think i got used to it or something cause they dont feel slipery at all, we got a wash/cleaning room in the warehouse and we use a lot of water and soup and dont have a problem at all (at first i had to be very careful and wall pretty slow). Now i got over 3 months with this boots and still feel and look pretty sturdy, my last boots cost me 45 bucks on amazon and died within a month, i got a fast paced work and this boots get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Maybe you'll like them more
customer_reviews.text: Most uncomfortable boot I've EVER WORN. I bought these for work. If I tried to wear them at work, I'd be disabled by the end of the day. I kept them because returning anything for me is very inconvenient. I wear them for going out. When I won't be putting my feet through the stress if a work day. They're good looking. And the look well made. So who knows. In 10 years perhaps they'll actually be comfortable. I buy boots from Amazon all the time. This was my most dissapointing purchase😟
customer_reviews.author: mctastic

customer_reviews.title: Good value boot
customer_reviews.text: I work in my boots, 40+ hours a week. I was pleasantly surprised by how quickly they broke in. No pain, and comfortable from day 1. The shank works, but feels a bit smaller than I would prefer, and you can really tell when you are on or off the shank. After a few months the front is scuffed up pretty good, so don’t buy this boot if you want something that is going to stay looking nice. I am concerned about weather resistance as each layer of weather proofing I put on seems to get scuffed off the front top quickly. Otherwise, at this price point, I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: P-Holcombe

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, slightly large in fit
customer_reviews.text: I use the boots when chainsawing (since your toes stick out from under the kevlar chaps) and so grip is important and my red wings were just too slippery. These grip really well. They are very comfortable ( took a 5 mi hike in them during some trail maintenance.) I normally can buy size 11s and they just fit, these are a bit loose, but some thicker boot socks made them perfect. No problem. Good arch support (I often replace the insoles in boots with some actually supporting ones, but the ones that came with it were fine). They look nice (I realize not a key feature) and the laces stay tied.
customer_reviews.author: H. Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Works great but fits big.
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear an 11 in men's so I ordered an 11. But I when I tried them on they were huge! Ended up exchanging them for a 10 and they fit great. Been using them a year now without issue. They're super comfy. My old boots I'd take off when I drove and put on tennis shoes, but these I'll wear all day driving or while on the construction site.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.text: The boot fits great, I get the support and comfort I was looking for, but the laces didn't last a month and neither did the material above the steel toe, they lasted about a week longer than the $27 Walmart brand boots, the sole is still going strong, truth be told I'm tough on my stuff but they are CATIPILLER work boots
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Rubbed my right foot raw. Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if these are factory defects or something being sold on Amazon. Replaced a worn out pair of Carolinas with these. I can't wear them now after 2 days, the left hand boot fits perfectly, the right one feels like it wasn't made correctly and has rubbed my foot so bad near my ankle and left side of my heel I have big blisters after two 10 hour days. These will be going in the trash and I'll buy another pair of boots locally. They're the skinniest wide boots I've ever had. Wouldn't recommend, wasted 90 dollars on trash product that I can't return now.
customer_reviews.author: Rbobby

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, the build quality is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, the build quality is excellent, all my coworkers told me they look great, the only thing i noticed is that they scratch really easy, but might just be the material of the boot, i had never had leather work boots so i was surprised by that. The fit is way better than my old dexter work boots, i have plenty of room in my feet and i added some insoles for more comfort. I will definitely buy this brand again, and i highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I came upon these boots from the numerous great reviews but after 2 months I became disappointed. The shoes fit fairly well, I ordered the xwide but I still found the toe box to be a bit tight. The problem came with the tread breaking off the boots after about 2 months at my job. These boots would be great for moderate use but if you work on concrete/steel for 8+ hours a day, then I couldn't recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BOOTS! But give them a minute!
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit as expected HOWEVER. I put them on and after about 10-15 minutes they Stretched to my comfort zone. I was close to returning because they didn't feel the way my previous ones did. But I allowed time to just try it and it all fell into place the way it should have. So if you experience same discomfort just put them on and walk around the house awhile. Been on my feet for a couple hours now and I don't hardly realize the difference from my used ones. Awesome dress boot goes with suites but still says I am ready to rumble! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Guy W. Seamster

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: First off, if you tie them too tight, the grommets that the laces go through dig into your ankle, the tongue doesn't stay centered. FYI I dont have much experience with steel toe boots in the winter, so i dont know if all of them do this or not, but condensation builds in the toe area and causes you to go to lunch with wet toes, didn't have this issue in the summertime. Only buy if you have really tough ankles, or like loose boots and work in a warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. This is exactly 1 year of use by my husband. He wears them 5-6 days a week for 8+ Hours. They held up pretty well with all the diets, grease and grime that he deals with. He started complaining just a few days ago that his feet were hurting and we realized how bad the insides had gotten. The support was just gone however, this is after a year of everyday use, so I would say these are priced fairly and held up pretty well!
customer_reviews.author: Laura B

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality, Not For All Day
customer_reviews.text: The boots are overall a decent quality for the price. However they are not designed for all day warehouse work, as the cushion is inadequate and I began to feel strain on my back. Swspped out insoles for high quality ones and it helped a little but still caused more fatigue then my Bates. I was hoping to use these for work to reduce wear on my other mire expensive boots, but I can't work all day in these.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say these are not made for the working man. I had high hopes for a CAT product, but they didn't last very long, only 7 months. The heel stitching came apart (see image). I gave 2-stars because the boots were comfortable after a little break in and some gel inserts. But..... I didn't even beat them up, I am a Sr. foreman nowadays and don't exactly do real hard labor anymore. My previous boots lasted 4 years of hard labor and only costs $ 40 more.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Best Work Boots I’ve Ever Worn
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn a lot of different work boots & have tried different socks & sole inserts. These Catepillar boots are the first boots that I have NOT had to customize to fit comfortablely. I’ve worn them everyday all day for the past 2 months and my feet are never sore. Very comfortable, warm & secure boot. Within the 1st week 1 boot string started to shred, I’ve been waiting for it to break but so far it has not, I’m shocked. Highly recommend these boots especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M Cox

customer_reviews.title: Dope boots
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get the boots with the CAT logo on the bottom. This is how you know it's legit. Other people have gotten the same looking boot but the bottom didnt have the logo making it a fake. These are actually my daily boots even when I go out and around town comfy and they look good in brown.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana

customer_reviews.title: Too large, loose
customer_reviews.text: The toe box was loose, the width was wider than label, it didn’t fit because it was larger (probably half inch or more larger). You might want to order about half inch smaller to fit correctly on your feet. Also these shoes were extremely heavy weight. I only wore them for few hours and ended up with lots of pain on my feet especially around the biggest toe and I decided to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Hersh

customer_reviews.title: Well made and strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my Dad and after one year and 7 months of abuse still solid. only complain he has, boots are heavy but worth the safety. He also added removable insoles for perfect fit and or arc support, can't tell on that not an expert.( I'm rating here strong product and durability, workhorse boots). Not talking about good looking or go 15 hours hiking boots. Remember that every job require different shoe models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot; Sizing not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice boots; they would have been perfect if they fit and I would have loved to keep them, but they were at least a size too large, so I am sending them back. I normally wear a 10, which is what these were marked, but they were much larger. I subsequently went and bought a similar Caterpillar boot locally, but without the steel toe, where I could try them on. The 10 was a tiny bit large, and a 9.5 fit perfectly. I really wish that these had fit, but I didn't want to be mailing them back and forth just to find the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Quality work boots at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Strong, good looking, decent value. I even bought a second pair years later to have a 'pretty' back-up pair. Just make sure you clean them up and put polish on them occasionally. The first thing to wear out (after a long time) are the boot laces. I wound up buying special laces made of kevlar to replace them ($11?).
customer_reviews.author: R or C Driskill

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews said that they were running on the small side so I ordered a half size larger than usual and selected "Wide". Having worked in them for a week now I find them very comfortable and they take knocks and bumps without abrading the leather. The high tops provide excellent ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: T. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Welder / Sheet Metal Fabricator
customer_reviews.text: Bending, lifting, hot spatter, resting sheets of aluminum and steel on the toes, etc. If you work in a shop then you know the abuse your footwear goes up against. I’ve owned multiple pairs. They last me about a year on average before the outsole starts to come apart. Laces go first about halfway through and I replace them. Gel insoles were a must with previous boots. With these I don’t need them but they do enhance them. In contrast I have a pair for weekend/casual wear. They’ve lasted three years so far. When I need to clean up for social functions a little kiwi polish and they look good as new. I highly recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: All ways a great boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my third or fourth pair I have owned of Caterpillar Men's Second Shift Steel Toe Work Boot. I wear a 10.5 W and the front of the toe is perfect. There are no odd angles. For example I bought a $160 pair of Golden Retriver boots at 10.5 W and had an odd angle at the toe. I wore them and my feet would get raw. A waste of money. So if you have a wide arch and wide at the toes Caterpillar is the boot for you. I also by New Balance and Sketchers for wide sneakers.

customer_reviews.title: Quality. Fits as expected. Looks good.
customer_reviews.text: My impression is that they are heavy and very sturdy. They are steel toe and thick quality leather. The wearer uses them for work at a factory, he reports them to be much heavier on his feet and stiff at the back of the ankle. Once broke in a bit he expects them to last much longer than any of the $50 pairs of cheapo boots...... As long as he can keep the bums from walking off the street into the break room & stealing this pair, he should be good.
customer_reviews.author: FatalDegree

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: My kid got his first 'grown up' job and is working hard. So, he needs something better than sneakers. The first day he wore them a tree they were installing/planting was dropped on his foot... have to love steel-towed boots. The did/ and are doing their job protecting the kid. Good boots, and good price.
customer_reviews.author: YouKnowMyName

customer_reviews.title: Love your feet - keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: Although these boots seem to be holding up fairly well, they are very painful to wear. At the end of every day I cannot wait to get them off of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Ravenbane

customer_reviews.title: They look more durable than they are.
customer_reviews.text: I'm rather disappointed. I didn't expect much out of a sub 100 dollar pair of boots, but I remained optimistic, nevertheless. I've worn them to work exactly one time for a 12 hour shift. Yet, already they have cuts and tears in the leather where it's coming apart. This is highly disappointing as I had expected these to last at least a few weeks before they began to show damage such as this.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: They look good, and seem high quality. I found them to be rather narrow in the toe area. I had blisters on both feet after wearing them one day, even with heavy socks.
customer_reviews.author: David Nails

customer_reviews.title: Finally a work shoe for narrow feet!
customer_reviews.text: My new size 8 Caterpillar steel toed work shoes fit like a glove. For years I had to put up with shoes listed as regular fit but were always too wide. They are reasonably priced and arrived in three days. These are narrow designed. They have wide styles also available.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Loved them right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them for my husband. He loved them right out of the box! That may not strike you as amazing, but my husband was a career U.S. Marine. These people are Very Picky about their feet and the shoes/boots they put them in! He wears them daily. I can't give any higher praise...
customer_reviews.author: Sekmet

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but not a work boot
customer_reviews.text: This boot was comfortable, looked and felt good. I wore them just around a couple of weeks to get use to them. The first day I wore them to work, the sole broke. I work construction so it is consistent work. I put my foot on the top of shovel to help push it through the dirt and the sole cracked. So, these would be good boots to wear out if you are into that, but I strongly suggest them not be used for construction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and actually stylish looking
customer_reviews.text: I got these boots for son who is taking up welding. They are quite comfortable for his flat feet. They definitely run true to size and the width is perfect. He wears them for 6 hours a day with zero problems and no complaints. The leather is very nice and surprisingly enough are not bad looking. I definitely recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: SherB

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, flexible and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for work, not too stiff and awkward, only took a day of walking to break them in. They're great quality for the price, but obviously you get what you pay for, I wont compare the quality of these to my RedWings brand boots, but they are more comfortable to walk in and they nice. Every day I wear them and I wonder where all the negative reviews on these come from.
customer_reviews.author: Tobacco Town LLC

customer_reviews.title: Not for tall feet
customer_reviews.text: Not enough room above the metatarsals. Great-fitting and very comfortable boot, otherwise. Note: the issue isn't the toe box, where the steel cap is -- it's about an inch behind the steel where the boot is just too small. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ragnar

customer_reviews.title: Get you by boots
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable but don’t expect years out of them. I’m an industrial electrician and work in an outdoor environment. I’ve had these boots for about 2 1/2 months and the sole where your toe pivots has split. Wasn’t expecting them to last too long and they are pretty comfortable. So if you need boots to get you by for a few months these will do the trick. Update: 5 months and the heel finally gave out
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jondreau

customer_reviews.title: Foot Protector and Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: I work in a warehouse facility loading tractor trailers and these boots are absolutely perfect for the job. The only discomfort comes from the top of the boots and they rub around the top of my ankles due to having to much spacing or wiggle room, because I ordered them a little large because of the width of my feet. I would recommend wearing double socks if you decide to order a size up but overall I am currently having no issues with my boots and though they are a bit heavy by the end of my shift my feet feel secure and protected at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Amos

customer_reviews.title: Not for fast food work!
customer_reviews.text: Any fast food worker knows you ask a ton from your boots, and for the most part they did, the fit was great, they had decent support, they look good, and steel toes are a plus. The only problem is their soles have zero slip resistance, (very important) as soon as I get on wet tile i can get an easy 8 feet of slide distance, which has become the only good way to get around. I'll be retiring these to something more heavy use/ concrete based since the boots seem to be very good quality otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: A little late writing this review as its been six months now, but I find them to be about the average pair of work boots. I did take many reviewers advice and purchase one 1/2 smaller for a more precise fit, and the fit was perfect. However, when I bought the Doctor Scholl's foot gel thingys you place in the bottom of shoes for additional support and comfort, it was very painful and I could not use them because I'm suspecting the shoe was a little smaller than my actual size and the fronts were too tight so keep that in consideration if you buy 1/2 size smaller if planning on using the supports.
customer_reviews.author: Aubin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive work boot for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, not tight at the toe or sides of my foot. My ankles were a bit sore when I wore them with shorter socks but that was my idiotic fault. While I wouldn't recommend these if you had to climb anything outdoors (such as ladders) I do recommend them if you're on the ground working. If you're indoors, there are more comfortable steel toe boots. Well worth the $28 I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Boston_Drinks

customer_reviews.title: Finally a boot that fits.
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot from a birth defect and have a hard time finding boots that fit. Red wing king toes are great 200 plus dollars, georgia giant were good but uncomfortable. These boots are great wide even with thicker socks and comfortable. So far i have worn them for two 11 hour work days driving, walking in gravel, dirt, hill sides, rain a little snow, wind so far so good. We will see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Brad & Jen

customer_reviews.title: Best work boot for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I have worked in the automotive and heavy-duty industry for about 13 years. These Boots are My go-to staple. You can usually get these between 50 and 70 bucks depending where you shop. I find that these boots last about a year heavy use. I tried boots twice or three times as expensive and they hold up about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Lucio

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I work as a machinist and I am on my feet at least 10 hours a day 6 days per week. I usually deal with sore feet from uncomfortable steel toes everyday. I was completely shocked to find boots that are comfortable from the second I put them on. Not only comfortable, but durable also. I have never been happier with work boots ever.
customer_reviews.author: QBASA

customer_reviews.title: Only boots my hubby will wear
customer_reviews.text: Husband love these boots. he does work in a warehouse settings Where they require steal toe boots. I have tried buying him other boots, but he refuses to wear anything but these. He is very hard on his shoes. They do seem to outlast everything else though.
customer_reviews.author: Breann H.

customer_reviews.title: Where is Caterpillar Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I sent the boots back because of a MAJOR MANUFACTURING DEFECT.. When a little water or ice gets in it would ruin the boots from the inside out. I expect if I pay premium prices I would get a premium product. This was not the case at all. This would have been my first pair of Caterpillar boots, but my first impression is Caterpillar does not care about quality, they only care about mass producing a crap product in a third world country for maximum profits. For what it's worth- I do not recommend Caterpillar boots.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase and then some.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots especially for my job. They are steel toe and surprisingly doesn't feel like they are which is a good thing for me. The only thing I did was took out the insoles and brought me a pair of Rite Aid brand of work boot insoles that I always get and replace in any new work boots I get. Oil resistant too. I work on Rail Cars so this color is perfect for me. Didn't want the lighter colors .
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Really bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this work shoes. I bought this for my brother as he started working in construction site. He only wore it about 2 weeks and the base rubber already started to break. Really bad material and quality. Return!!
customer_reviews.author: Bayraa

customer_reviews.title: Good work or casual boot
customer_reviews.text: Returned for larger size so I could use inserts but nice boot I also decided to get the soft toe version in black the sole is nice and also there is a shock absorbing spot right at the ball of the foot witch is good as I get sore feet right at the ball of my feet also the steel toe is not too heavy as I own other steel toe boots and compared I also ordered this boot by mistake witch ended up great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots were perfect for working on the farm around cattle. They have no arch support which I already expected. The toe box, width and fit were true to size. I will definitely recommend these boots and already have to someone who also purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy, good build, get some gels though.
customer_reviews.text: I used this working at a fabrication shop for the last 8 months, I had to replace the shoe laces because I dinged up one of the holes and it cut into the lace, but overall they held up really well. I highly recommend getting some gels inside the boots, but they held up under some truly awful circumstances. They saved my feet on several occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Size, Wrong Colour
customer_reviews.text: I ordered size 9 US and according to their size chart, this meant 7 UK. this was not the case. I received size 8 UK, which is a size larger. Secondly, the colour advertised was not the colour I received as it was shades lighter. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: thin leather
customer_reviews.text: I wear holes in the leather on the sides of the boot before I wear the rubber out Also wears hole over the steel toe . but , that’s kind of a common thing for any boot Boots used to be better than this i feel like nothing is made for work anymore . all for show
customer_reviews.author: <^^^Z^^^^Z^^**,,,,,;

customer_reviews.title: Solid Boot
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy solid boot, it will last a long time, but after 13-14 hours they really will do a number on your toes. I have skinny toes and sometimes they feel too tight on the sides of my toes, the rest of the shoe fits great. They are comfortable to wear when walking normal distances. I use them in a factory, and I think I would rather get shoes that have a steel toe next time. I have worked other jobs that these would be better suited for, they can take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Chance McMaster

customer_reviews.title: insoles like I said are junk
customer_reviews.text: Not as well built as they were 10 years ago. Only had a few months and the insoles are totally trashed. Will buy some inserts to get a lot more life. Laces have gotten cheaper, stitching seems weaker, insoles like I said are junk. But they are pretty affordable. Ive worn cat boots every single day for 15 years, so they are still good enough that I tolerate the low points. I'd suggest a boot dryer for anyone to extend the life with less odor.
customer_reviews.author: jeffw

customer_reviews.title: Went strong for three years long.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these boots. The last pair lasted three years. It wasn’t until this last 2 months that they finally fell apart. The picture is a photo of the three year old pair next to the new pair. I’m by no means soft on my boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dbcombo1

product_meta.title: Caterpillar Men's Second Shift Steel Toe Work Boot
product_meta.description:
The Second Shift Steel Toe work boot delivers protection, comfort and durability to get you through your day regardless of the work at hand. Rugged styling and quality leathers make this boot an easy everyday choice on and off the job.

As the world's foremost manufacturer of heavy equipment, Cat earthmovers are known around the world as a symbol of honest work, strength and integrity. Cat Footwear makes boots and shoes based on these same principals. The brand has evolved from work boots into a range of industrial and casual footwear built with the sole purpose of staying true to their original goal--creating genuine, hard-working boots and shoes.
feature_bullets: Ankle-cut work boot with steel toe with padded ankle and oil-resistant outsole
